title: Authors and Citation
text: Dubey Y (2024). worldhdi: Human Development Index Worldwide 1990-2022. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {worldhdi: Human Development Index Worldwide 1990-2022},   author = {Yash Dubey},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: Human Development Index Worldwide 1990-2022
text: goal worldhdi present Human Development Index Data 1990-2022 tidy format. data sourced United Nations Development ## Installation can install development version worldhdi GitHub : Alternatively, can download individual datasets CSV XLSX file table .
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("openwashdata/worldhdi") ## Run the following code in console if you don't have the packages ## install.packages(c("dplyr", "knitr", "readr", "stringr", "gt", "kableExtra")) library(dplyr) library(knitr) library(readr) library(stringr) library(gt) library(kableExtra) library(tidyverse) library(lubridate)

title: Human Development Index Worldwide 1990-2022
text: package provides access tidy human development index (HDI) 193 countries 1990-2022. data sourced United Nations Development Programme (UNDP)

title: Human Development Index Worldwide 1990-2022
text: dataset worldhdi contains data human development index (HDI) 193 countries 1990-2022. 210 observations 17 variables overview variable names, see following table.

title: Human Development Index Worldwide 1990-2022
code: library(worldhdi) library(ggplot2) library(rnaturalearthdata) library(rnaturalearth)  # 2022 HDI worldwide  world <- ne_countries(scale = "medium", returnclass = "sf")  world_map_data <- world |> left_join(worldhdi, by = c("iso_a3" = "iso3c"))  hdi_colors <- c("#d73027", "#fc8d59", "#fee08b", "#fdae61", "#fdd49e", "#feedde",                  "#d9ef8b", "#a6d96a", "#66bd63", "#1a9850", "#00441b", "#003300", "#001a00",                  "#e0e0e0")   ggplot(data = world_map_data) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = cut(hdi_2022,                           breaks = c(-Inf, 0.399, 0.449, 0.499, 0.549, 0.599, 0.649, 0.699,                                      0.749, 0.799, 0.849, 0.899, 0.950, Inf),                           labels = c("≤ 0.399", "0.400–0.449", "0.450–0.499", "0.500–0.549",                                      "0.550–0.599", "0.600–0.649", "0.650–0.699",                                      "0.700–0.749", "0.750–0.799", "0.800–0.849",                                      "0.850–0.899", "0.900–0.950", "≥ 0.950")))) +   scale_fill_manual(values = hdi_colors, na.value = "gray90", name = "HDI 2022 Brackets") +   theme_minimal() +   labs(title = "World HDI Map (2022)", subtitle = "Colored by HDI Brackets") +   theme(axis.text = element_blank(),         axis.ticks = element_blank(),         panel.grid = element_blank())

what: Which countries saw the biggest increases in HDI over this period?
title: Human Development Index Worldwide 1990-2022
code: worldhdi |>    filter(!is.na(avg_growth_1990_2022)) |>    arrange(desc(avg_growth_1990_2022)) |>    select(country, avg_growth_1990_2022) |>   head(10) |>    gt::gt() |>   gt::as_raw_html()

title: Human Development Index Worldwide 1990-2022
code: # Use the rows where country is Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, # Arab States, East Asia and the Pacific, Europe and Central Asia, Latin America and the Caribbean, World and plot the hdi trends using hdi_1990, hdi_2000, hdi_2010, hdi_2015, hdi_2022  worldhdi |>   filter(country %in% c("Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development",                          "Arab States", "East Asia and the Pacific",                          "Europe and Central Asia", "Latin America and the Caribbean", "World")) |>   pivot_longer(cols = starts_with("hdi"),                 names_to = "year",                 values_to = "hdi") |>   mutate(year = gsub("hdi_", "", year),  # Remove "hdi_" prefix          year = ymd(paste0(year, "-01-01")),  # Convert to date format          country = ifelse(country == "Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development", "OECD", country)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = year, y = hdi, group = country, color = country)) +   geom_line() +   geom_point() +   scale_x_date(date_labels = "%Y", date_breaks = "10 years") +  # Format x-axis as date and show every 10 years   labs(title = "Trends in HDI by Region", y = "HDI", x = "Year", color = "Country") +  # Set legend title   theme_minimal()
